summary: An FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, discussing operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. The email outlines the need for agents to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was issued. He was believed to be in France at the time.

events.title: Operational Planning for Arrest and Search
events.description: FBI agents were instructed to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, and interview co-conspirators.

events.title: Deployment to Florida for Subpoenas
events.description: The email mentions the need to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI planned to execute a search warrant at Epstein's residence in New York City and interview co-conspirators.
Two FBI agents were to be deployed to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals as part of the investigation.
The email indicates the investigation required coordination across the entire FBI squad, with assistance from other units, highlighting the scale of the operation.
